text: Jeffrey Franklin Kent (born March 7, 1968) was an American baseball player. He played second base. He played for six different teams, including the New York Mets, San Francisco Giants, and Los Angeles Dodgers. He was a five-time All- Star, and the 2000 National League MVP. In his career, he batted .290, with 2,461 hits, 377 home runs and 1,518 RBIs. He has more home runs than any other second baseman. He also drove in 90 or more batters in nine straight seasons. Kent was from Bellflower, California and went to high school in Huntington Beach. ==Other websites== Category:1968 births Category:Baseball players from California Category:Cleveland Indians players Category:Houston Astros players Category:Living people Category:Los Angeles Dodgers players Category:National League All-Stars Category:New York Mets players Category:San Francisco Giants players Category:Toronto Blue Jays players
title: Jeff Kent
